{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3606444,"name":"John Robinson Grace","username":"Tradesurplus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T20:12:26.652Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen a few mentions of teams using thermal cameras for fault detection and post match inspection. Looking for new hotspots as an indicator of problems.

Has anyone here actual done this? If so has it been useful in identifying issues?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T20:12:26.652Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":139.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500780,"topic_slug":"thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool","display_username":"John Robinson Grace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool/500780/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606446,"name":"Ian Bae","username":"soriiku17","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soriiku17/{size}/211323_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T20:18:38.908Z","cooked":"

yup!! we bought a thermal imager this year and used it quite a bit. i can think of 3 instances that we used it for

  • tracking temperature to process srpp and polycarb
  • our elevator kraken x60 was getting hot sometimes later on in the season and we were able to use the imager to see what temperatures it was going to and find the issue
  • at nycr (NYNY) this year, there was a team who was having comms errors and their rio was getting hot. using the imager we saw where the heat source was and was able to identify a specific spot where a metal shaving was causing a short

overall its not a necessary tool but it does make troubleshooting sometimes easier and lowkey fun

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T20:18:38.908Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":156.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500780,"topic_slug":"thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool","display_username":"Ian Bae","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"frc 694!!"},"post_url":"/t/thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool/500780/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606597,"name":"Austin Plummer","username":"Austin_Plummer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/austin_plummer/{size}/245236_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T23:11:54.660Z","cooked":"

I’ve used a thermal camera to trouble shoot problems for quite a few years. With advanced logging it becomes less useful but being able to see an issue in real time is super helpful.

Some problems I have found with the thermal camera-
Electrical -
Shorts on wires run through tubes
Bad Breakers on PDH
Loose connections on Battery
Bad power pole crimps
Bad solder under heat shrink
Mis wired compressors
Bad electrical components(VRM/PCM)
Metal shaving causing shorts

Mechanical -
Bad Bearings
Binding mechanisms
Rubbing wheels
Pneumatic leaks
Motors fighting each other in drivetrains

It ends up coming in handy specifically when first coming back from a match with issues. Seeing a glowing wire leading right to the problem mechanism/motor helps a lot for speed of diagnosis. Its not a required tool but definitely useful in some scenarios.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T23:11:54.660Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":86.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500780,"topic_slug":"thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool","display_username":"Austin Plummer","primary_group_name":"Plummer-Industries","flair_name":"Plummer-Industries","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/0/3/038658a75b96d943aea24b2be19e36a11c1624be.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":63,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Plummer Industries"},"post_url":"/t/thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool/500780/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606601,"name":"Ian McTavish","username":"Ian_McTavish","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T23:20:31.490Z","cooked":"

We used one to check out wiring connections - a bad crimp will tend to be hotter. One of our mentors is a firefighter so we’re able to get easy access.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T23:20:31.490Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500780,"topic_slug":"thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool","display_username":"Ian McTavish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17356,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/thermal-camera-as-troubleshooting-tool/500780/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606603,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T23:21:12.585Z","cooked":"

I got a Mustool MT13S, and I’ve been bringing it to a few competitions as CSA. It’s been interesting, but so far not as useful as I hoped. Mostly it rules out certain possibilities. With one team, I was able to show them that the power wiring for one swerve module was much hotter than the other circuits. In another case, I could show them that all four swerve modules were very hot. I’m still learning how to make it a useful part of my toolkit.
